sentence.Network_en: Women once again are having fewer children and spacing them further apart.
sentence.Network_cn: 女人再次减少了生孩子的数量，而且生育之间相隔的时间也更长了。

sentence.Network_en: I was spacing out the seedlings into divided trays.
sentence.Network_cn: 我正在把那些小嫩苗分装进有分格的盘子里。

sentence.Network_en: Generous spacing gives healthier trees and better crops.
sentence.Network_cn: 足够大的间距能使树木和庄稼长得更茁壮。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 这样，我们就有必要引进德里达的一个概念：spacing(间距)。间距一词，用德里达的话来说，就是“时间的变化着的空间或空间变化着的时间。”.

entry.def: Spacing refers to the way that typing or printing is arranged on a page, especially in relation to the amount of space that is left between words or lines.

example.ex: Please type or write clearly in double spacing on one side of A4 paper only.
example.tran: 请用A4纸、以双倍行距单面打印或誊抄，字迹务必清晰。

means.word_mean: 1. the time between occurrences of a repeating event;

sentences.sentence: "some women do not control the spacing of their children"

means.word_mean: 2. the property possessed by an array of things that have space between them
